title: 13+ Survival Gardening Crops To Grow To Live Off Your Garden

tasks.task: Planting and caring for a survival garden with emphasis on calorie-dense and nutrient-rich crops.
subtasks: Choose suitable crops based on climate (e.g., sweet potatoes, cassava, yams, bananas/plantains, pigeon peas, Southern peas).
Set up perennial structures like fencing with yucca/cassava for calorie storage.
Grow annuals like sweet potatoes, cassava, and yams in well-drained soil; provide sufficient water and nutrients.
Propagate tropical fruits (bananas, papayas) through cuttings or pups.
Include calorie-dense nuts and berries in colder climates.
Plant medicinal herbs like turmeric, ginger, and elderberry.
Sow self-seeding annuals like daikon radishes for ground cover and fermentation.
Encourage pollinators with herbs and flowers.
Integrate leafy greens (moringa, chaya, katuk) for vitamins and minerals.
Create a nitrogen-fixing system with legumes (pigeon peas, sesame).

tasks.task: Planting and maintaining a survival garden focused on high-yield, nutritious crops suitable for a warm climate.
